ratings.comment: Professor Brooks is incredibly helpful in office hours. Many times this semester, I have been stumped on a project, and he is very good at walking you through the logic required to understand the issue. I have been very happy with his help outside of the class during this online semester.
Easy class. Homework due every week on wednesday.

Can be confusing sometimes because he thinks of algorithms much more deeply than the students, but is always willing to stop and explain. Very kind and will give help if needed. Also has jolly ranchers.

While the grading in CS300 may have been tough and sometimes downright harsh, this isnt because of any professor, as most of the grading in this class was automated. As for Alexander Brooks, he was a great teacher and never had a mean thing to say. He was available a lot outside of class for anyone struggling. Class? Tough. Teacher? Great

He's a sweet guy, but he's boring and the class itself is terribly structured, though he seems not to have control over the class structure. A huge portion of the projects are already written and the written portions are not explained. Very nitpicky grading, and understanding project instructions is tougher than the coding.
Do not take, teaches away from the course curriculum. He doesn't make the test so not helpful at all for the exams you are given.
Alexander has a poor ability in describing the program requirements, which confuses me a lot. Avoid him if you can.

301 was my first programming class and I asked a lot of silly questions throughout the course, but Alexi was always patient to answer them, either in class or outside of class. His lectures are fine. He also gives helpful handouts before lecture to help you take notes.

Alexi is a solid professor but he isn't one I would recommend for an intro course. He teaches as if the students already know a fair amount of what he's talking about and that holds him back. Super intelligent and the homework isn't too bad. The exams are pretty tough but not impossible. Lectures are dry & you kind of self-teach yourself everything

Would have had a much better experience in this class if they hadn't turned the semester into a social experiment. Alexi is an okay lecturer. He's only a grad student, and this was just his second semester teaching the class, so I wasn't expecting the world from him. That said, he was about what I expected. He taught the material well enough.

Don't choose him!!!! His lecture is boring and not helpful. Randomly assign 6 people into a group to do group projects and randomly assign two people to do the post-project quiz? Seriously? Why don't you just listen to what students think and be realistic?  The most terrible lecturer ever.
Good professor, but very dry and boring which makes it hard to stay awake in class. Projects and tests are very difficult in this class.
